intro: Aganisia tricolor, commonly known as the three-color aganisia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, trifoliate leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
